title: Reframing Jan. 6: After the Pardons, the Purge
summary: In its campaign of “uprooting the foot soldiers,” the Trump Justice Department has fired or demoted more than two dozen Jan. 6 prosecutors, even as those they sent to prison walk free.

title: A Muted Homecoming for Kilmar Abrego Garcia
summary: Mr. Abrego Garcia, who was wrongfully deported to El Salvador, is keeping a low profile as his lawyers prepare to fight the Trump administration’s proposal to deport him to Uganda.

title: Peace Talks in Ukraine All Lead to the Donbas
summary: The contested region is where Russia’s war in Ukraine began a decade ago. Scores of Ukrainian soldiers have died defending it. Would Ukraine give it up now?

title: Why the Donbas Is the Key to the Ukraine War
summary: Talks of a cease-fire in Ukraine have centered on the Donbas, a valued region for both sides and where most of the fighting is taking place. Michael Schwirtz, a global intelligence correspondent, and Anatoly Kurmanaev, a foreign correspondent covering Russia, break down who the Donbas is important to and why.

title: Why Haven’t Sanctions on Russia Stopped the War? The Money Is Still Flowing.
summary: For decades, companies feared being on the wrong side of U.S. sanctions. That’s not always true anymore.

title: Zelensky Marks Ukraine’s Independence Day With Diplomacy in Kyiv and a Plea for Peace
summary: The Ukrainian leader held talks with Prime Minister Mark Carney of Canada and was set to meet with President Trump’s envoy, Keith Kellogg, amid continuing diplomatic efforts to end the war.

title: As Other Israelis Die in War, Ultra-Orthodox Resist Call to Fight
summary: Ultra-Orthodox Israelis, exempt for decades from military service, are now being drafted. Their rage is dividing Israel and threatening Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s coalition.

title: The ‘Lioness’ at the Center of a City Hall Battered by Scandal
summary: Before Ingrid Lewis-Martin was indicted on bribery charges, she was one of the most powerful people in Mayor Eric Adams’s orbit. Now she may hasten his fall in New York.

title: Why Is Andrew Cuomo Still Running for Mayor? The Answer May Lie in 1977.
summary: Mario Cuomo’s failed mayoral campaign was a training ground for his son Andrew, who would mount his own bid decades later.

title: Calabasas Residents Learn Grim Lesson Amid Toxic Landfill Controversy
summary: Calabasas residents thought it would be easy to keep wildfire ash from being trucked to their local landfill. They were wrong.

title: Everything You Need to Know About the 2025 U.S. Open
summary: The tournament runs Aug. 24 to Sept. 7 at the Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in New York City.

title: New England Boaters Battle a Coast Guard Plan to Remove Beloved Buoys
summary: The agency said a proposal to get rid of 350 navigational buoys from Maine to New Jersey made sense after decades of advancement in electronic navigation tools.

title: What the ‘Panama Playlists’ Exposed About Spotify User Privacy
summary: The “Panama Playlists” exposed the Spotify listening habits of some famous people — and two journalists who didn’t know as much about protecting their privacy as they had thought.

title: Survivors of Bus Crash Near Buffalo Recount Harrowing Ordeal
summary: The crash of the tour bus, which was headed from Niagara Falls to New York City on Friday, left five dead. Their names were released by the authorities on Saturday.

title: These Moms Want to Design Your Dorm Room
summary: Influencers are making money online by recommending dorm products and designs to families, who spend thousands of dollars on back-to-college shopping.

title: Trump Is Defunding Medical Research. It Could Cost You Your Life.
summary: They hoped to make tomorrow’s medicines. Then came Trump.

title: How ChatGPT Surprised Me
summary: What if we come to love and depend on the A.I.s — if we prefer them in many cases to our fellow humans?

title: Revealing Taste
summary: A clever leak exposed the music habits of some famous people — and two Times journalists.

title: Singer Marko Perkovic’s Fascist-Era Salute Evokes a Bloody Time in Croatia
summary: There’s a new generation of fans for the singer known as Thompson, who uses the salute and nationalist rhetoric to cast himself as a guardian of Croatian heritage.

title: Hundreds Languish in Pakistan’s Prisons on Blasphemy Charges
summary: In Pakistan, hundreds are in jail on charges of blaspheming Islam. Rights groups say some of these cases are due to bad actors entrapping victims online.

title: They Put Off Getting in Relationships Until They Earned Enough Money
summary: Money can’t buy love, but it can help single people feel more ready to find it.

title: The Menendez Brothers’ Momentum Built for Years. It Was Dashed in 2 Days.
summary: Young people energized a push for redemption — and the release of Lyle and Erik. Parole commissioners took a different view and a harder line.
